modelIdentification.name: NETN-ETR
modelIdentification.purpose: The NETN ETR module provides a common standard interface for sending tasks to simulated entities represented in a federated distributed simulation. ETR contains common low level tasks that can easily be interpreted and executed by simulators that model the behavior of entities. It also defines a set of reports to provide status information, including the status of the tasks being executed by simulated entities.
modelIdentification.description:
NATO Education and Training Network (NETN) Entity Tasking and Reports (ETR) Module.
This module is a specification of how to represent simulation tasks requests provided to participants in a federated distributed simulation and simulator reports sent during the execution of tasks. The specification is based on IEEE 1516 High Level Architecture (HLA) Object Model Template (OMT) and primarily intended to support interoperability in a federated simulation (federation) based on HLA. An HLA OMT based Federation Object Model (FOM) is used to specify types of data and how it is encoded on the network. The NETN ETR FOM module is available as an XML file for use in HLA based federations.
modelIdentification.useLimitation: The NETN ETR FOM module is simulation oriented and focuses on tasks with a fine granularity: * It enables the transformation of command and control messages into tasks that can be executed by a simulator. * It defines status reports that can be used for producing command and control reports needed for decision-making. * It supports the modelling of simulated command and control interactions between federates in a distributed simulation, for example during a MRM disaggregation process. * It contains a comprehensive set of tasks and reports that can easily be interpreted and executed by simulators. * It reflects the capabilities commonly found in COTS Computer Generated Forces (CGF) tools, but it is independent of a specific COTS CGF tool, agent framework, or agent modelling paradigm. * It is independent of any specific doctrine or tactics. An entity in ETR can be either a physical entity (e.g. platform or lifeform) or an aggregate entity. If a task or report relates to only a physical entity or to only an aggregate entity, then this is specified in the definition of the task. In the definition of each task it is not specified how an entity (physical or aggregate) will / should perform the task.
modelIdentification.useHistory: NETN-LBML_v1.1.0 - Developed by MSG-106 and MSG-134 for NETN-FOM v2.0.
v2.0.0 - Renamed and updated by MSG-163 for NETN-FOM v3.0

poc.pocName: MSG-163 Evolution of NATO Standards for Federated Simulation
MSG-134 NATO Distributed Simulation Architecture & Design, Compliance Testing and Certification
MSG-106 Enhanced CAX Architecture, Desing and Methodology

modelIdentification.other:
Copyright © 2020 by NATO/OTAN. All rights reserved. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NoDerivatives 4.0 International License.
Above license gives you the right to use and redistribute this FOM Module (XML file and Documentation) in its entirety without modification. You are also allowed to develop your own new FOM Modules (in separate XML files and separate documentation) that build-on/extends this FOM module by reference. You are NOT allowed to modify this FOM Module or its documentation without prior permission by the NATO Modelling and Simulation Group.

objectClass.name: BaseEntity
objectClass.semantics: A base class of aggregate and discrete scenario domain participants. The BaseEntity class is characterized by being located at a particular location in space and independently movable, if capable of movement at all. It specifically excludes elements normally considered to be a component of another element. The BaseEntity class is intended to be a container for common attributes for entities of this type. Since it lacks sufficient class specific attributes that are required for simulation purposes, federates cannot publish objects of this class. Certain simulation management federates, e.g. viewers, may subscribe to this class. Simulation federates will normally subscribe to one of the subclasses, to gain the extra information required to properly simulate the entity.

objectClass.name: Platform
objectClass.semantics: A physical object under the control of armed forces upon which sensor, communication, or weapon systems may be mounted.

attribute.name: CurrentTaskProgresses
attribute.semantics: Optional. Array of current task progresses

attribute.name: PreviousTasks
attribute.semantics: Optional. Array of completed or cancelled tasks.

attribute.name: PlannedTasks
attribute.semantics: Optional. Array of all planned tasks.

objectClass.name: Lifeform
objectClass.semantics: A living military platform (human or not).

attribute.name: CurrentTaskProgresses
attribute.semantics: Optional. Array of current task progresses

attribute.name: PreviousTasks
attribute.semantics: Optional. Array of completed or cancelled tasks.

attribute.name: PlannedTasks
attribute.semantics: Optional. Array of all planned tasks.

objectClass.name: AggregateEntity
objectClass.semantics: A group of one or more separate objects that operate together as part of an organization. These objects may be discrete, may be other aggregate objects, or may be a mixture of both.

attribute.name: CurrentTaskProgresses
attribute.semantics: Optional. Array of current task progresses

attribute.name: PreviousTasks
attribute.semantics: Optional. Array of completed or cancelled tasks.

attribute.name: PlannedTasks
attribute.semantics: Optional. Array of all planned tasks.

objectClass.name: Task
objectClass.semantics: Object to represent a task independently in the federation when needed.

attribute.name: TaskDefinition
attribute.semantics: Required. Definition description of the task represented.

attribute.name: TaskProgress
attribute.semantics: Required. Progress description of the task represented.

interactionClass.name: ETR_Root
interactionClass.semantics: Root interaction class for the Entitiy Tasking and Reporting (ETR) interaction classes.

interactionClass.name: ETR_Report
interactionClass.semantics: A base interaction class for more specialized report interaction classes.

parameter.name: ReportId
parameter.semantics: Required. Uniqie identifier for the report.

parameter.name: When
parameter.semantics: Required. Date and time when the reported status was valid.

parameter.name: CommunicationNetworkIds
parameter.semantics: Optional. Reference to communication networks (NETN-COM) used to transfer report messages. If not provided, the report transmission should not be modelled and federates should receive and act on the report messages directly.

parameter.name: Comments
parameter.semantics: Optional. Any additional comments associated with the report.

interactionClass.name: InWeaponRangeReport
interactionClass.semantics: Report on a unit's ability to reach specific targets with its weapon systems.

parameter.name: Observer
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the entity that observed another entity in range of its weapons.

parameter.name: WeaponType
parameter.semantics: Required. The type of the weapon that is in range.

parameter.name: EntitiesInWeaponRange
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to entities in rage of the weapon.

interactionClass.name: SpotReport
interactionClass.semantics: Report on a unit's awareness of spotted entities.

parameter.name: Observer
parameter.semantics: Required. Entity that observed the enemy (or neutral/unknown entity) and sends the spot report.

parameter.name: IdentificationLevel
parameter.semantics: Required. The identification level of the entit(y)(ies) spotted.

parameter.name: SpottedEntities
parameter.semantics: Required. Spotted entities at the time specified in the parameter 'When'.

interactionClass.name: SensorReport
interactionClass.semantics: Report on a unit's sensor detection of entities.

parameter.name: SensorType
parameter.semantics: Required. The type of the sensor that detected the entities.

interactionClass.name: StatusReport
interactionClass.semantics: Report on a unit's own (perceived) state. This report should be generated with a frequency specified in the federation agreements.

parameter.name: EntityId
parameter.semantics: Required. The entity that is reported about.

interactionClass.name: DamageStatusReport
interactionClass.semantics: Report on a unit's damage status.

parameter.name: DamageType
parameter.semantics: Required. Damage state of the reported entity.

interactionClass.name: PositionStatusReport
interactionClass.semantics: Report on a unit's position, speed, and heading.

parameter.name: Position
parameter.semantics: Required. Position of the entity at the specified time.

parameter.name: Heading
parameter.semantics: Required. Heading of the entity.

parameter.name: Speed
parameter.semantics: Required. Speed of the entity.

interactionClass.name: ResourceStatusReport
interactionClass.semantics: Report on a unit's remaining amount resources.

parameter.name: Resource
parameter.semantics: Required. The type of resource and remaining quantity.

interactionClass.name: UnderAttackStatusReport
interactionClass.semantics: Report from a unit that it is under attack.

parameter.name: FromDirection
parameter.semantics: Required. Direction from which the entity is attacked, between 0..2π or -1 when not specified.

parameter.name: Severeness
parameter.semantics: Required. Severeness of the attack upon the reporting entity.

interactionClass.name: ETR_SimCon
interactionClass.semantics: A base interaction class for EXCON Task interaction classes.

parameter.name: TaskId
parameter.semantics: Required. Uniqie identifier for the simulation control task.

parameter.name: Taskee
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the entity that should execute the task.

parameter.name: Tasker
parameter.semantics: Optional. Indentifies the commander of the task.

parameter.name: MainTaskId
parameter.semantics: Optional. Unique ID of the main task.

parameter.name: PreviousTaskId
parameter.semantics: Optional. Unique ID of the previous task.

parameter.name: NextTaskId
parameter.semantics: Optional. Unique ID of the next task.

interactionClass.name: CapabilitiesSupported
interactionClass.semantics: Provides the set of ETR_Task, ETR_SimCon and ETR_Report interactions that the federate modelling the entity supports. This interaction is in response to a QuerySupportedCapabilities.

parameter.name: CapabilityNames
parameter.semantics: Required. Array of task and report names that the entity supports; the names match with the FOM class names of NETN-ETR Tasks, Reports and SimCon interactions.

interactionClass.name: MagicMove
interactionClass.semantics: A simulation control task that instructs the entity to immediately jump to the specified location and update the new position and heading.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.semantics: Required. Location of the entity.

parameter.name: Heading
parameter.semantics: Required. Heading of the entity.

parameter.name: LocationUuid
parameter.semantics: Optional. The new location for the entity. Refered by a UUID.

interactionClass.name: MagicResource
interactionClass.semantics: A simulation control task that instructs the entity to set amount of available resources immediately

parameter.name: Resource
parameter.semantics: Required. Defines the resource type that will get a new quantity value.

interactionClass.name: QuerySupportedCapabilities
interactionClass.semantics: Query which tasks, reports and SimCon actions that an entity supports. The queried entity shall respond with a CapabilitiesSupported message.

interactionClass.name: ETR_Task
interactionClass.semantics: A base interaction class for more specialized task interaction classes.

parameter.name: TaskId
parameter.semantics: Required. Uniqie identifier for the task.

parameter.name: Taskee
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the entity that will execute the task.

parameter.name: Tasker
parameter.semantics: Optional. Callsign of the commander of the task. If missing, the commander is undefined.

parameter.name: StartWhen
parameter.semantics: Required. Time when the task execution should start. Use the value 00000000000000.000 to indicate that the time is undefined.

parameter.name: Why
parameter.semantics: Optional. A text describing the reason for this task.

parameter.name: TaskMode
parameter.semantics: Required. Determines the task mode.

parameter.name: CommunicationNetworkIds
parameter.semantics: Optional. Reference to communication networks (NETN-COM) used to transfer tasking messages. If not provided, the task transmission should not be modelled and federates should receive and act on the task messages directly.

parameter.name: MainTaskId
parameter.semantics: Optional. Unique ID of the main task.

parameter.name: PreviousTaskId
parameter.semantics: Optional. Unique ID of the previous task.

parameter.name: NextTaskId
parameter.semantics: Optional. Unique ID of the next task.

parameter.name: Activity
parameter.semantics: Optional. Specifies the activity for the entity that will execute the task. If not specified, left up to creator.

interactionClass.name: ClearEngineering
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to clear any SeObject with the given UUID. The tasked entity should be within a certain distance (tolerance specified in the federation agreement) of one of the points of the geometry of the obstacle.

parameter.name: UniqueId
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the Obstacle to clear.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: Optional. Time to clear the SeObject. If unspecified, this is decided by federate accepting the task.

interactionClass.name: Dismount
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to dismount from a mounted position. When the task is completed, the tasked entity is no longer attached to or embarked in another entity.

interactionClass.name: DisruptCommunication
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to introduce a communication network disruption.

parameter.name: AffectedCommunicationNetwork
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the affected Communication Network. If not provided all communication networks are affected.

parameter.name: AffectedArea
parameter.semantics: Required. Area affected by disruption.

parameter.name: DisruptionEnabled
parameter.semantics: Required. Disruption enabled or disabled. Default is True = Enabled.

interactionClass.name: Engineering
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to preform field engineering (represented by SeObject from NETN-SE)

parameter.name: UniqueId
parameter.semantics: Optional. Unique ID of object to create. If not specified, left up to creator.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.semantics: Required. Name of the object to create. Should (but is not required to) be unique.

parameter.name: Geometry
parameter.semantics: Required. Variant record with WorldLocationStructs representing the different ways SeObjects (NETN-SE) locations are represented. PointObject = WorldLocationStruct, LinearObject = WorldLocationPath and ArealObject = WorldLocationLenghtlessArray.

parameter.name: TimeToComplete
parameter.semantics: Optional. Time to complete the SeObject. If unspecified, this is decided by federate accepting the task.

parameter.name: ObstacleType
parameter.semantics: Required. The type of the obstacle defined by the entity type of the obstacle (SISO REF-010 Land Culture Features) .

interactionClass.name: CreateBreach
interactionClass.semantics: Creates a breach or passage on a Se-Object. Discriminant on GeometryType decides if it is a Point, Line or Areal breach.

parameter.name: HostObjectId
parameter.semantics: Required. UUID of object where breach will be applied.

interactionClass.name: LayMinefield
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to create a minefield within the specified geometry. When the task is completed, a minefield object should be published in the federation (e.g. NETN-SE Minefield). This tasking interaction is different from the RPR-FOM MinefieldObjectTransaction interaction, which asks a federate to create a minefield magically.

parameter.name: TypeOfMines
parameter.semantics: Required. Type of mines used, defined in SISO-REF-010

parameter.name: MineCount_MineDensity
parameter.semantics: Required. Count or density of mines.

interactionClass.name: CreateObstacle
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to create an obstacle with the given geometry. The tasked entity should be within a certain distance (tolerance specified in the federation agreement) of one of the points of the geometry.

interactionClass.name: FireAtEntity
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to fire at another specified target entity.

parameter.name: Target
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the target entity.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: Optional. The duration of the fire (Milliseconds).

interactionClass.name: FireAtEntityWM
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to fire at a specified target entity with the specified weapon and munition data.

parameter.name: WeaponTypeToUse
parameter.semantics: Required. Preferd weapon type.

parameter.name: MunitionTypeToUse
parameter.semantics: Required. Prefered munition type.

parameter.name: QuantityFired
parameter.semantics: Required. Number of rounds.

parameter.name: RateOfFire
parameter.semantics: Required. Number of rounds per second.

interactionClass.name: FireAtLocation
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to fire at a location.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.semantics: Required. The location to fire at.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: Required. The duration of the fire (milliseconds).

parameter.name: LocationUuid
parameter.semantics: Optional. The location to fire at by reference to a NETN SE, SE_GeoObject.

interactionClass.name: FireAtLocationWM
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to fire at a location with the specified weapon and munition.

parameter.name: WeaponTypeToUse
parameter.semantics: Required. Preferd weapon type.

parameter.name: MunitionTypeToUse
parameter.semantics: Required. Prefered muntion type.

parameter.name: QuantityFired
parameter.semantics: Required. Number of rounds to fire

parameter.name: RateOfFire
parameter.semantics: Required. Number of rounds per second.

interactionClass.name: FollowEntity
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to follow another entity at a specified distance.

parameter.name: Entity
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the entity to follow.

parameter.name: Behind
parameter.semantics: Required. The distance in meters behind the entity to follow.

parameter.name: Right
parameter.semantics: Required. The distance in meters to the right of the entity to follow.

parameter.name: Above
parameter.semantics: Required. The distance in meters above the entity to follow.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: Required. The duration of the follow action (milliseconds).

interactionClass.name: Move
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to move in a specified direction for a given duration of time.

parameter.name: Direction
parameter.semantics: Required. Direction of movement (compass degrees). Heading 0 deg refers to East. Heading 90 deg refers to North.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: Required. The duration of the move (milliseconds).

interactionClass.name: MoveIntoFormation
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to move into the given formation on the given location with the given heading.

parameter.name: Formation
parameter.semantics: Required. The type of positional arrangement the entity.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.semantics: Required. The location to move to.

parameter.name: Distance
parameter.semantics: Required. The minimum distance between entities in the formation.

parameter.name: Heading
parameter.semantics: Required. The heading of the formation. Compass degrees Heading 0 deg refers to East. Heading 90 deg refers to North.

interactionClass.name: MoveToEntity
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to move to another entity. If a path is provided, the entity should follow the path as its route to the entity. The entity should align with the path from its current position to the nearest position or waypoint on the path. The entity should leave the path at position or waypoint on the path closest to the destination entity. The entity moves directly towards the destination entity if no path (or a zero-length path) is provided.

parameter.name: Entity
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the entity to move to.

parameter.name: Path
parameter.semantics: Optional. Route to the specified entity.

parameter.name: MoveType
parameter.semantics: Required. Indicates if roads have to be followed.

interactionClass.name: MoveToEntityWithSpeed
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to move to another entity. If a path with speed is provided, the entity should follow the path as its route to the entity. The entity should align with the path from its current position to the nearest position or waypoint on the path. The entity should leave the path at position or waypoint on the path closest to the destination entity. The entity moves directly towards the destination entity if no path (or a zero-length path) is provided.

parameter.name: Entity
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the entity to move to.

parameter.name: PathWithSpeed
parameter.semantics: Optional. Route with speed to the specified entity.

parameter.name: MoveType
parameter.semantics: Indicates if roads have to be followed.

interactionClass.name: MoveToLocation
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to move to the specified destination location. If a path is provided, the entity should follow the path as its route to the destination. The entity should align with the path from its current position to the nearest position or waypoint on the path. The entity should leave the path at position or waypoint on the path closest to the destination. The entity moves directly towards the destination location if no path (or a zero-length path) is provided.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.semantics: Required. The location to move to.

parameter.name: Path
parameter.semantics: Optional. A route to use in order to move to the Location.

parameter.name: MoveType
parameter.semantics: Required. Indicates if roads have to be followed.

parameter.name: PathUuid
parameter.semantics: Optional. Path to use to get to the Location by reference to a NETN_SE, SE_GeoObject.

parameter.name: LocationUuid
parameter.semantics: Optional. The location to move to, by reference to a NETN_SE, SE_GeoObject.

interactionClass.name: MoveToLocationWithSpeed
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to move to the specified destination location with a given speed for each waypoint. If a path is provided, the entity should follow the path as its route to the destination. The entity should align with the path from its current position to the nearest position or waypoint on the path. The entity should leave the path at position or waypoint on the path closest to the destination. The entity moves directly towards the destination location if no path (or a zero-length path) is provided.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.semantics: Required. The location to move to.

parameter.name: Path
parameter.semantics: Optional. A route to use in order to move to the Location.

parameter.name: MoveType
parameter.semantics: Required. Indicates if roads have to be followed.

interactionClass.name: Mount
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of entity to mount the specified entity. The tasked entity should be within a certain distance (tolerance specified in the federation agreements) of the location of the entity to mount.

parameter.name: EntityId
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the entity to mount.

interactionClass.name: Observe
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to observe an area.

parameter.name: ObservationArea
parameter.semantics: Required. Area to observe.

interactionClass.name: OperateCheckPoint
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to operate a checkpoint. The tasked entity should be within a certain distance (tolerance specified in the federation agreements) of the location of the checkpoint. If not, a separate move task should be issued first. The tasked entity activates an inactive checkpoint and operates the checkpoint for the specified duration of time.

parameter.name: UniqueId
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the checkpoint to operate.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: Required. The duration of the operation of the checkpoint (millisecond).

parameter.name: DelayTime
parameter.semantics: Optional. New DelayTime attribute for the checkpoint to be operated on. If left blank the DelayTime will remain the same.

interactionClass.name: Patrol
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to perform a patrol. The tasked entity moves from its current position to the start of the patrol route and then moves according to patrol route from its start point in the path, through all waypoints.

parameter.name: Path
parameter.semantics: Required. Specifies the route to patrol.

parameter.name: PatrolType
parameter.semantics: Required. Defines how the patrol should be excuted. The full movement from start point, through the patrol route and back to the start point is called one cycle.

parameter.name: MoveType
parameter.semantics: Required. Defines how the entity shall move during the patrol route.

parameter.name: PathUuid
parameter.semantics: Optional. Path for the patrol by reference to a NETN_SE, SE_GeoObject.

interactionClass.name: PatrolRepeating
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to repeat a patrol for a given duration. When the duration time has passed, then the last cycle of the patrol is completed before the task ends. If the time of a cycle takes longer then the interval time, then the cycle starts directly (without delay). If the time of a cycle takes less than the interval time, then the entity waits at the first point of the patrol route until the next cycle is started.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: Required. The duration of the total patrol task.

parameter.name: IntervalTime
parameter.semantics: Required. The time between the start of two cycles, i.e. the time to complete a cycle and any waiting time before starting the next cycle.

interactionClass.name: PatrolWithSpeed
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to perform a patrol. The tasked entity moves from its current position to the start of the patrol route and then moves according to patrol route from its start point in the path, through all waypoints with the speed specified.

parameter.name: Path
parameter.semantics: Required. Specifies the route to patrol.

parameter.name: PatrolType
parameter.semantics: Required. Defines how the patrol should be excuted. The full movement from start point, through the patrol route and back to the start point is called one cycle.

parameter.name: MoveType
parameter.semantics: Required. Defines how the entity shall move during the patrol route.

interactionClass.name: PatrolRepeatingWithSpeed
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to repeat a patrol for a given duration. When the duration time has passed, then the last cycle of the patrol is completed before the task ends. If the time of a cycle takes longer then the interval time, then the cycle starts directly (without delay). If the time of a cycle takes less than the interval time, then the entity waits at the first point of the patrol route until the next cycle is started.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: Required. The duration of the total patrol task.

parameter.name: IntervalTime
parameter.semantics: Required. The time between the start of two cycles, i.e. the time to complete a cycle and any waiting time before starting the next cycle.

interactionClass.name: SetOrderedAltitude
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to set move to specified altitude.

parameter.name: Altitude
parameter.semantics: Required. Defines the altitude.

parameter.name: AltitudeType
parameter.semantics: Required. Above the ground or sea.

interactionClass.name: SetOrderedSpeed
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to change speed.

parameter.name: Speed
parameter.semantics: Required. Determines the ordered speed to set for an entity, in m/s.

interactionClass.name: SetRulesOfEngagement
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to change its rules of engagement.

parameter.name: RulesOfEngagement
parameter.semantics: Required. Determines the rules of engagment for an entity.

interactionClass.name: SetTransmitterStatus
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to switch on/off all of its transmitters.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.semantics: Required. Status on the transmitter.

interactionClass.name: StopAtSideOfRoad
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to stop at the side of the road. This task is only relevant for an entity that is moving along a road to a destination. The executing move task is cancelled, and a new move is defined towards a position at the side of the road (the simulator has to calculate this location).

interactionClass.name: TurnToHeading
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to turn to the specified heading.

parameter.name: Heading
parameter.semantics: Required. The heading an entity has to turn to. Heading 0 rad refers to East. Heading pi/2 rad refers to North.

interactionClass.name: TurnToOrientation
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to rotate to a specified orientation, including pitch and roll.

parameter.name: Pitch
parameter.semantics: Required. Defines the angle ot the pitch.

parameter.name: Roll
parameter.semantics: Required. Defines the angle ot the roll.

interactionClass.name: Wait
interactionClass.semantics: Tasking of an entity to wait for a duration of time.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.semantics: Required. Specifies the wait time (milliseconds).

interactionClass.name: ETR_TaskManagement
interactionClass.semantics: A base interaction class for more specialized task management interaction classes.

parameter.name: TaskManagementId
parameter.semantics: Required. Uniqie identifier for the management task.

parameter.name: Taskee
parameter.semantics: Required. Reference to the entity that should execute the task.

parameter.name: Tasker
parameter.semantics: Optional. Identifies the commander of the task.

parameter.name: CommunicationNetworkIds
parameter.semantics: Optional. Reference to communication networks (NETN-COM) used to transfer task management messages. If not provided, the message transmission should not be modelled and federates should receive and act on the task management messages directly.

interactionClass.name: RequestTaskStatusReport
interactionClass.semantics:
Requests the responsible federate to send TaskStatusReport interactions for the specified tasks.
For this class, the Taskee parameter is Optional, and refers to the entity for whom task status reports are being requested. If omitted, request refers to all tasks specified in Tasks. At least one of Taskee or Tasks must be specified.

parameter.name: Tasks
parameter.semantics: Optional. Tasks for which status reports are being requested. If omitted, request refers to all previously sent tasks with the specified Taskee. At least one of this Parameter or Taskee must be specified.

interactionClass.name: RequestFederateTaskCancel
interactionClass.semantics: Send a request to target federate to cancel current remote task.

parameter.name: FederateId
parameter.semantics: Required. Target federate.

parameter.name: TaskId
parameter.semantics: Required. Unique ID of task to be canceled.

interactionClass.name: FederateTaskRequestResponse
interactionClass.semantics: Response if the task will be executed.

parameter.name: ResponseStatus
parameter.semantics: Required. If the task is accepted or refused.

interactionClass.name: RequestFederateTaskExecution
interactionClass.semantics: Interaction to request a remote execution of a task.

parameter.name: FederateId
parameter.semantics: Required. Unique ID of target federate.

parameter.name: TaskDefinition
parameter.semantics: Required. Task definition of the task to be executed.

interactionClass.name: CancelAllTasks
interactionClass.semantics: Management task to an entity to cancel all queued and ongoing tasks.

interactionClass.name: CancelSpecifiedTasks
interactionClass.semantics: Management task to an entity to cancel all specified tasks.

parameter.name: Tasks
parameter.semantics: Required. Tasks that should be cancelled.

interactionClass.name: TaskStatusReport
interactionClass.semantics: A management task report regarding the status of a specific task assigned to an entity.

parameter.name: TaskId
parameter.semantics: Required. Identifies the task associated with the task report.

parameter.name: TaskStatus
parameter.semantics: Required. Indicates the status of the task.

parameter.name: When
parameter.semantics: Required. Creation date and time of the report.

parameter.name: Comments
parameter.semantics: Optional. Any additional comments. For example reason for cancelling, errors, etc.

enumeratedData.name: RemoteTaskResponseStatusEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Response status for remote task execution tasks.

enumeratedData.name: RulesOfEngagementEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: Rules of engagment for a simulated entity.

enumeratedData.name: IdentificationLevelEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics: The identification level of an object.

enumeratedData.name: MoveTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: CrossCountry: move directly to the destination without taking into account the roads. OnlyRoads: stay on the roads to get to the closest point to the destination that is still on a road; if there is no road very near to the start (within around 10 meters) there will be no movement at all. RoadsAndCrossCountry: move to the destination by taking into account the roads; it is allowed to go off the road.

enumeratedData.name: AttackTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: The kind of attack by the enemy.

enumeratedData.name: TaskModeEnum8
enumeratedData.semantics:
Execute task in non-concurrent mode or concurrent mode.
In the non-concurrent mode the task is placed on the task list for the entity, which serves as a waiting list. Once the task is at the head of the task list, and the currently executing task completes, it is removed from the task list and started. Using this task mode, tasks are executed one after the other.
In the concurrent mode, the task is executed concurrently with other tasks. As soon as the task is accepted for an entity, it is started. With this task mode, there is no task list involved.

enumeratedData.name: PatrolTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Other - The behaviour is federate application specific (e.g. wait for next command, etc.) Circle - At the end of route, move to start point of patrol route (federate application determines the route) Reverse - Follow the patrol route in reverse order.

enumeratedData.name: PatrolMoveTypeEnum32
enumeratedData.semantics: Defines how the movment shall be done during the execution of the patrol. Other - Federate application specific.

arrayData.name: Datetime18
arrayData.semantics: A designation of a specified chronological point measured using Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) ISO 8601:2000 as a standard of reference, constrained to "zero meridian" i.e. �Zulu� time zone only. This is expressed as a composite field using a compacted ISO notation YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.SSS where YYYY represents a year, MM represents a month in values from 00 to 12, and DD represents a day in values from 00 to 31, HH represents an hour, MM represents a minute, and SS.SSS represents the number of seconds and milliseconds.

arrayData.name: ArrayOfSpottedEntities
arrayData.semantics: The spotted entities at a specific time

arrayData.name: ArrayOfSpottedEquipment
arrayData.semantics: An array with spotted equipment at the spotted entity.

fixedRecordData.name: SpottedEntity
fixedRecordData.semantics: Descripton of the observed entity. The symbol contains information about the spotted entity's relation to the spotter and details about the type and echelon at the spotted entity.

field.name: SpottedEntity
field.semantics: The unique identifier for the entity

field.name: Location
field.semantics: The location where the entity were spotted

field.name: Orientation
field.semantics: The orientation in Psi, Theta, Phi [radians]

field.name: Speed
field.semantics:
The speed of the entity (m/s).
Default value: 0 m/s

field.name: Equipment
field.semantics:
Spotted equipment list, type and number.
Default value: Empty array.

field.name: Activity
field.semantics: The current activity of the entity. (Fromm NETN-Base) Default value: Moving (213)

field.name: Symbol
field.semantics: Symbol identifier for the entity. The detailed level may vary and the publishing federate decides the level of details in the symbol description. E.g. Default Ground value: app6b:SUGP------***** Default Air value: app6b:SUAP------***** Default Sea Surface value: app6b:SUSP------***** Default Subsurface value: app6b:SUUP------*****

fixedRecordData.name: SpottedEquipment
fixedRecordData.semantics: Equipment at the spotted entity.

field.name: Type
field.semantics: Use entity types from Supply Types, Expendibles or Sensors/Emitters tables (SISO-REF-010-2010, 4.3), for aggregate entities, also use entity types from platform tables to describe the equipment type.

field.name: NumberOfEquipment
field.semantics: The number of the equipment.

fixedRecordData.name: FollowEntityTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for FollowEntity

field.name: FollowedEntity
field.semantics: Reference to the entity to follow.

field.name: Behind
field.semantics: The distance in meters behind the entity to follow.

field.name: Right
field.semantics: The distance in meters to the right of the entity to follow.

field.name: Above
field.semantics: The distance in meters above the entity to follow.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: The duration of the follow action (Milliseconds).

field.name: Location
field.semantics: Location where the object was spotted.

fixedRecordData.name: TaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Fixed record to describe definition of a task.

field.name: TaskId
field.semantics: Unique identifier for the task.

field.name: Taskee
field.semantics: Reference to who is executing the task.

field.name: Tasker
field.semantics: Callsign of the commander of the task.

field.name: StartWhen
field.semantics: Timestamp of when the task should start.

field.name: Why
field.semantics: A text describing the reason for this task.

field.name: TaskMode
field.semantics: Determines the task mode.

field.name: CommunicationNetworkIds
field.semantics: Reference to the communication networks (NETN-COM) used to transfer this task.

field.name: Activity
field.semantics: Suggested activity for unit executing this task.

field.name: Status
field.semantics: Current status of this task.

field.name: DefinitionData
field.semantics: Task specific definition details.

field.name: MainTaskId
field.semantics: Unique identifier of the main task if this task is part of a complex task sequence. Equals TaskId if this task is the main task.

field.name: PreviousTaskId
field.semantics: Unique identifier of the previous task if this task is part of a complex task sequence. Null if this task is the first in the sequence.

field.name: NextTaskId
field.semantics: Unique identifier of the next task if this task is part of a complex task sequence. Null if this task is the last in the sequence.

fixedRecordData.name: TaskProgress
fixedRecordData.semantics: Fixed record to describe progress of a task.

field.name: TaskId
field.semantics: Reference to the task this progress belongs to.

field.name: LastUpdated
field.semantics: When was this task last updated.

field.name: ExecutingFederateId
field.semantics: Reference to the federate that is executing this task.

field.name: ETC
field.semantics: Estimated time to completion.

field.name: ProgressData
field.semantics: Variant record with task specific progress data.

fixedRecordData.name: MoveToLocationTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for MoveToLocation task.

field.name: Location
field.semantics: Location to move to.

field.name: Path
field.semantics: Path to use in order to move to Location.

field.name: MoveType
field.semantics: Indicates if roads have to be followed.

fixedRecordData.name: PatrolTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific task for a single Patrol task.

field.name: Path
field.semantics: Specifies the route to patrol.

field.name: PatrolType
field.semantics: Defined how the patrol should be executed. The full movement from start point, through the patrol route and back to the start point is called one cycle.

field.name: MoveType
field.semantics: Defines how the entity shall move during the patrol route.

fixedRecordData.name: EngineeringTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for Engineering tasks.

field.name: Name
field.semantics: Name of the object to create

field.name: Geometry
field.semantics: The geometry of the object to create. Point geometry will create a PointObject; Path geometry will create a LinearObject; Polygon geometry will create an ArealObject. This parameter contextualizes the Type parameter.

field.name: Type
field.semantics: Type of object to create. Must be interpreted in context of the Geometry parameter.

field.name: Comment
field.semantics: Comment to add to the created object.

field.name: TimeToComplete
field.semantics: The time it shall take the tasked entity to create the object. If unspecified, this is decided by federate accepting the task.

fixedRecordData.name: LayMinefieldTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for LayMinefield Task, builds on CreateSeObjectTaskDefinition.

field.name: BaseSeObjectTaskDefinition
field.semantics: Reference to base object.

field.name: Density
field.semantics: Mine density

fixedRecordData.name: PatrolRepeatingTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for PatrolRepeating task, builds on PatrolTaskDefinition.

field.name: PatrolTaskDefinition
field.semantics: Reference to base patrol.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: The duration of the total patrol task.

field.name: IntervalTime
field.semantics: The time between the start of two routes.

fixedRecordData.name: FireAtEntityTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for FireAtEntity task.

field.name: UUID
field.semantics: Target to fire at.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: Duration of the fire (milliseconds). Can be 0

fixedRecordData.name: FireAtEntityWMTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for fireAtEnityWM task, builds on FireAtEntity task.

field.name: FireAtEntityTask
field.semantics: UUID and duration.

field.name: WeaponTypeToUse
field.semantics: Preferred weapon type.

field.name: MunitionTypeToUse
field.semantics: Preferred munition to use.

field.name: QuantityFired
field.semantics: Number of rounds.

field.name: RateOfFire
field.semantics: Number of rounds per second.

fixedRecordData.name: FireAtLocationTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task spcific data for FireAtLocation task.

field.name: Location
field.semantics: Locataion of where to fire.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: How long to fire for.

fixedRecordData.name: FireAtLocationWMTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for FireAtLocationWM task, builds on FireAtEntity.

field.name: FireAtLocationTask
field.semantics: UUID and duration.

field.name: WeaponTypeToUse
field.semantics: Preferred weapon type.

field.name: MunitionTypeToUse
field.semantics: Preferred munition to use.

field.name: QuantityFired
field.semantics: Number of rounds.

field.name: RateOfFire
field.semantics: Number of rounds per second.

fixedRecordData.name: WaypointWithSpeed
fixedRecordData.semantics: Extended WorldLocationStruct that includes speed.

field.name: WorldLocationStruct
field.semantics: Coordinate to move towards.

field.name: Speed
field.semantics: Speed over ground for an entity, in m/s.

fixedRecordData.name: MoveToLocationWithSpeedTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for MoveToLocationWithSpeed task.

field.name: Path
field.semantics: Array of extended waypoints.

field.name: MoveType
field.semantics: Indicates if roads have to be followed.

field.name: Location
field.semantics: Location to move to, using extended waypoint.

fixedRecordData.name: ClearEngineeringTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for ClearSeObject.

field.name: UniqueId
field.semantics: Unique ID of the object to be cleared.

field.name: TimeToComplete
field.semantics: The time it shall take the tasked entity to clear the object. If unspecified, this is decided by federate accepting the task.

fixedRecordData.name: SetOrderedSpeedTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for setOrderedSpeed task.

field.name: Speed
field.semantics: Determines the ordered speed to set for an entity, in m/s.

fixedRecordData.name: SetOrderedAltitudeTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for SetOrderedAltitude

field.name: Altitude
field.semantics: Defines the altitude.

field.name: AltitudeType
field.semantics: Above the ground or sea.

fixedRecordData.name: CreateBreachTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task definition of createSeBreach task.

field.name: BaseSeObjectTaskDefinition
field.semantics: Reference to base object.

field.name: HostObjectId
field.semantics: UniqueId of the host object.

fixedRecordData.name: MountTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for Mount task.

field.name: EntityId
field.semantics: Reference to the entity to mount.

fixedRecordData.name: DismountTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for Dismount task.

fixedRecordData.name: PatrolWithSpeedTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for Patrol_EXT task.

field.name: Path
field.semantics: Path with speed.

field.name: PatrolType
field.semantics: Defined how the patrol should be executed. The full movement from start point, through the patrol route and back to the start point is called one cycle.

field.name: MoveType
field.semantics: Indicates if roads have to be followed.

fixedRecordData.name: PatrolRepeatingWithSpeedTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for PatrolRepeating_EXT Task, builds on PatrolTaskDefinition_EXT.

field.name: PatrolWithSpeedTaskDefinition
field.semantics: Reference to base extended patrol.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: The duration of the total patrol task.

field.name: IntervalTime
field.semantics: The time between the start of two routes.

fixedRecordData.name: CreateCheckpointTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for CreateCheckpoint.

field.name: BaseSeObjectTaskDefinition
field.semantics: Base CreateSeObject task.

fixedRecordData.name: OperateCheckpointTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for OperateSeCheckpoint.

field.name: UniqueId
field.semantics: UniqueId of the checkpoint to operate.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: How long to operate the checkpoint for (Milliseconds).

fixedRecordData.name: WaitTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for Wait task.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: Specifies the wait time (milliseconds).

fixedRecordData.name: DisruptCommunicationTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for DisruptCommuncation

field.name: AffectedCommunicationNetowrk
field.semantics: Reference to the affected Communication Network. If not provided all communication networks are affected.

field.name: AffectedArea
field.semantics: Area affected by disruption.

field.name: DisruptionEnabled
field.semantics: Disruption enabled or disabled. Default is True = Enabled.

fixedRecordData.name: MoveTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Tasking of an entity to move in a specified direction for a given duration of time.

field.name: Direction
field.semantics: Direction of movement (Compass degrees). Heading 0 deg refers to East. Heading 90 deg refers to North.

field.name: Duration
field.semantics: The duration of the move.

field.name: Formation
field.semantics: The type of positional arrangement the entity.

field.name: Location
field.semantics: The location to move to.

field.name: Distance
field.semantics: The minimum distance between entities in the formation.

field.name: Heading
field.semantics: The heading of the formation. Heading 0 deg refers to East. Heading 90 deg refers to North.

fixedRecordData.name: MoveToEntityTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for MoveToEntity.

field.name: Entity
field.semantics: Reference to the entity to move to.

field.name: Path
field.semantics: Route to the specified entity. If not specified, take the linear path.

field.name: MoveType
field.semantics: Indicates if roads have to be followed.

fixedRecordData.name: MoveToEntityWithSpeedTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for MoveToEntityWithSpeed.

field.name: Entity
field.semantics: Reference to the entity to move to.

field.name: Path
field.semantics: Route to the specified entity.

field.name: MoveType
field.semantics: Indicates if roads have to be followed.

fixedRecordData.name: ObserveTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for Observe.

field.name: ObservationArea
field.semantics: Area to observe.

fixedRecordData.name: SetRulesOfEngagementTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for SetRulesOfEngagement.

field.name: RulesOfEngagement
field.semantics: Determines the rules of engagment for an entity.

fixedRecordData.name: SetTransmitterStatusTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for SetTransmitterStatus.

field.name: Status
field.semantics: Status on the transmitter.

fixedRecordData.name: StopAtSideOfRoadTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for StopAtSideOfRoad.

fixedRecordData.name: TurnToHeadingTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Tasking of an entity to turn to the specified heading.

field.name: Heading
field.semantics: The heading an entity has to turn to. Heading 0 rad refers to East. Heading pi/2 rad refers to North.

fixedRecordData.name: TurnToOrientationTaskDefinition
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task specific data for TurnToOrientation.

field.name: Pitch
field.semantics: Defines the angle ot the pitch.

field.name: Roll
field.semantics: Defines the angle ot the roll.

fixedRecordData.name: ElapsedTimeProgress
fixedRecordData.semantics: Progress definition for tasks only needing elapsed time. Used for the following tasks: ClearEngineering Engineering CreateBreach CreateCheckpoint LayMinefield CreateObstacle OperateCheckpoint Wait FollowEntity Move

field.name: ElapsedTime
field.semantics: Elapsed time since beginning of task

fixedRecordData.name: FireAtTaskProgress
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task progress data for FireAtLocation, FireAtLocationWM, FireAtEntity and FireAtEntityWM

field.name: ElapsedTime
field.semantics: Elapsed time since beginning of task.

field.name: MunitionUsed
field.semantics: Number of rounds used if specified.

fixedRecordData.name: MoveTaskProgress
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task progress data for all move tasks with a path (MoveToEntity, MoveToLocation, MoveToLocationWithSpeed, Patrol and PatrolWithSpeed).

field.name: LastPassedWaypointIndex
field.semantics: Index of last passed waypoint.

field.name: NextWaypointIndex
field.semantics: Index of next waypoint.

fixedRecordData.name: PatrolRepeatingProgress
fixedRecordData.semantics: Task progress data for repeating patrol tasks.

field.name: PathProgress
field.semantics: Progress of the current path.

field.name: ElapsedTime
field.semantics: Time elapsed for entire task.

field.name: IntervalElapsedTime
field.semantics: Time elapsed in the latest interaval.

variantRecordData.name: MineCountVariantStruct
variantRecordData.semantics: The number or density of mines.

variantRecordData.name: TaskProgressVariantRecord2
variantRecordData.semantics: Variant record for task progress data.

variantRecordData.name: WorldLocationVariantStruct

alternative.name: Point
alternative.semantics: A signle point represented as a WorldLocationStruct.

alternative.name: Path
alternative.semantics: A array representing a path given in WorldLocationStructs.

alternative.name: Polygon
alternative.semantics: A polygon used to represent ArealObjects (NETN-SE)

variantRecordData.semantics: A point, path or area described in WorldLocationStructs (NETN-SE).

note.label: netn-etr_1
note.semantics:
The interaction classes are organized in a root class and four base classes: ETR_Task, ETR_Report, ETR_TaskManagement, and ETR_SimCon.
* ETR_Root: root interaction class for the Entitiy Tasking and Reporting (ETR) interaction classes. * ETR_Task: A base interaction class for more specialized task interaction classes. * ETR_Report: A base interaction class for more specialized report interaction classes. * ETR_TaskManagement: A base interaction class for more specialized task management interaction classes. * ETR_SimCon: A base interaction class for more specialized Simulation Control (SimCon) interaction classes

note.label: COPY-RPRnoteBase1
note.semantics: Federates shall send the time at which the data is valid in the user defined tag with every attribute values update and interaction; see datatype RPRUserDefinedTag for the encoding. All federates shall transmit this field, even if they do not use it themselves, so that other federates can use its value to compensate for network transport delays.
